The whole concept of 'giving' loans to unqualified borrowers under shady payback rules started with Jimmy Carter. Bill Clinton made it worse. Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac have provided millions of dollars in personal income to those appointed to run them. They need some regulation.
 
 Since this is from a liberal magazine, the proximate cause -- the Community Reinvestment Act of 1977 (JC's administration), amended/liberalized in 1995 (BJC's administration) and used as a club over Wall Street's head by the Dems in Congress -- is not mentioned, but it does show the key to the companies' collapsing versus their being able to weather the loan crisis.
 
 http://www.newyorker.com/talk/financial/2008/09/29/080929ta_talk_surowiecki
